summary: The communications sector—comprising mostly private broadcast, cable, satellite, wireless, and wired systems and networks—is vital to national security. The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency supports the security and resilience of this sector, primarily through incident management and information-sharing activities. For instance, the agency coordinates federal activities during severe weather events, and manages cybersecurity programs. However, the agency has not assessed the effectiveness of its programs...
title: Critical Infrastructure Protection: CISA Should Assess the Effectiveness of its Actions to Support the Communications Sector
